Description: Lower body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup, possibly a little master cup; interior: glazed upper wall; three dilute lines lower down and trace of tondo decoration; exterior: reserved band in handle zone, with glaze band at the bottom; glazed below.
Type series: Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type (possibly)
Curator's comments: The lack of a rim prevents a definitive identification of the cup as a South Ionian cup with everted rim. However, the concentric lines on the interior surface of the sherd find parallels with those around the tondo on other South Ionian little master cups and South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9B (which coincide with Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type XI [Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116]) or Ionian Cups Type 9C. This type finds parallels with the shape of Attic Little Master lip-cups. These cups have been found in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.823) (Phase 3)
